citations.narrative:
An enclosure housing two adult Emu has an exposed sharp wire point over the water source. The wire is being used to
secure the water bucket in the enclosure. However, the loose end of the wire hangs over the water source approximately
4 inches. At the time of inspection, the Licensee bent the wire end outward, so it was not accessible to the animals.
Failure to ensure that no sharp points are present in enclosures housing birds can result in injuries to the birds. Primary
enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are structurally sound. Correct by
ensuring that all primary enclosures are kept in good repair and are free of sharp points or edges that could injure birds.
Correct by 9-OCT-2024.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the Licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Mark Sanderbeck, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n

narrative:
3.153(a)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
An enclosure housing two adult Emu has an exposed sharp wire point over the water source. The wire is being used to

4 inches. At the time of inspection, the Licensee bent the wire end outward, so it was not accessible to the animals. 
Failure to ensure that no sharp points are present in enclosures housing birds can result in injuries to the birds. Primary 
enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are structurally sound. Correct by 
ensuring that all primary enclosures are kept in good repair and are free of sharp points or edges that could injure birds.

Additional Inspectors: 
Mark Sanderbeck, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n
